  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT 11;31AM UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED A LEAKER IN DOOR 26 RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND RESPONDED TO THE CALL. RESPONDER ENTERED THE TRAILER AND DISCOVERED A LEAKING 5GAL BUCKET INSIDE WITH TOXIC 6 LABEL, RESPONDER RIKKI FOLLOWED THE DECISON TREE. PROCCEEDS TO PLACE BUCKET INTO SPILL TRAY TO CONTAIN THE SPILLAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024111056
item.description:
Report X-2024111056

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-30T12:29:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: CHASKA
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Jose Perez, CHECKER/DRIVER REG, called safety to report a spill in trailer 401481. Jose stated that when he backed to the customers dock to unload, the customer stated they would not accept the freight (UN3093, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S., 8 (5.1), PG II) due to a plug in the center of the top red lid being missing and the freight possibly being contaminated. Jose stated that after inspecting the tote, he found that approximately 8oz of the product had spilled out of the top lid where the plug was missing, onto the side of the tote and the trailer floor. Jose stated he did not see the plug missing when he left the Service Center and looked in the trailer for the plug but could not find it. Jose stated the customer advised he could stay parked at dock door #1 while the cleaning crew assists in cleaning the spill in the trailer and on the tote.

item.title: Report E-2024110553
item.description:
Report E-2024110553

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twenty (20) ounces of material released from two (2) 2-gallon plastic pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being damaged. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Onsite personnel gathered the spent waste and materials used to clean up the affected area of the trailer and characterized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
